io::FindFile Class Reference
[Input/output library]

#include <FindFile.h>

Inheritance diagram for io::FindFile:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

FindFile iterates path names in a single directory or recursively in sub-directories.

The class can be used to find files or directories by user-specified name or by user specified properties.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum io::FindFile::AttribFlags
 

File attributes.

Enumeration values:
ATTRIB_NORMAL  Normal.

File has no other attributes set, and can be read or written to without restriction.

ATTRIB_ARCHIVE  Archive.

Set whenever the file is changed.

ATTRIB_HIDDEN  Hidden file.
ATTRIB_READONLY  Read-only.

File cannot be written to, and a file with the same name cannot be created.

ATTRIB_SUBDIR  Subdirectory.
ATTRIB_SYSTEM  System file.

enum io::FindFile::FindFlags
 

Options for file finding.

Enumeration values:
FIND_RECURSE  Recurses into subdirectories.

This is default.

FIND_FILESONLY  Directory names are not returned in iteration.

This is default.

FIND_DEFAULT  Default options.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

io::FindFile::FindFile (  const lang::String &  filter,
int  flags = FIND_DEFAULT
)  [explicit]
 

Starts iterating through files with specified filter.

Filter can include optional path name and wildcards in the filename, as in for example "D:/data/*.txt". If no files can be found then more() will return false.

Parameters:
filter File name filter with optional initial (root) path.
flags Filter flags, see FindFlags.

io::FindFile::~FindFile (   ) 
 

Ends iteration.
